title: Airbus cuts delivery forecast amid production problems
text:
Production problems have forced Airbus to cut the number of planes it expects to deliver this year.

The company, which builds the wings for its airliners in north Wales, now expects to deliver 860 this year, down from an earlier target of 880 to 890.

Announcing third quarter results, chief executive Guillaume Faury said the lower deliveries reflected action to ensure a more efficient production flow in the coming years.

Airbus is struggling to work out how to make the “cabin flex” version of its bestselling A320neo family. The fuselage can be modified and enlarged from the standard aircraft, allowing it to carry more passengers and extend the range.

The company is hoping to increase the number...
description: Production problems have forced Airbus to cut the number of planes it expects to deliver this year.
